body:
Here is the workaround from the forum thread - creating a ecdsa key pair for the server

```
ssh-keygen -t ECDSA -f id_ecdsa
rclone serve -vv sftp --key id_ecdsa .
```

This seemed to work in my tests provoking an ECDSA key exchange.

Probably what rclone should do is generate an ECDSA key as well as an rsa key and load them both.

I've had a go at this here

[v1.57.0-beta.5696.a4dc76b9d.fix-5671-serve-sftp](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5671-serve-sftp/v1.57.0-beta.5696.a4dc76b9d.fix-5671-serve-sftp/) on branch [fix-5671-serve-sftp](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5671-serve-sftp) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

So if you try this you shouldn't need the `--key` parameter because rclone will generate its own ECDSA key.

Let me know if that works for you!

Works beautifully now, without the need for a `--key` parameter. Thanks!

```
$ rclone -vv serve sftp b2: --addr 127.0.0.1:2020
<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5695.269f90c1e" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "serve" "sftp" "b2:" "--addr" "127.0.0.1:2020"]
<7>DEBUG : rclone: systemd logging support activated
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "b2:"
<7>DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "b2plain:<bucket_name>"
<6>INFO  : Encrypted drive 'b2:': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
<5>NOTICE: Loaded 2 authorized keys from "/home/user/.ssh/authorized_keys"
<7>DEBUG : Loaded private key from "/home/user/.cache/rclone/serve-sftp/id_rsa"
<7>DEBUG : Loaded private key from "/home/user/.cache/rclone/serve-sftp/id_ecdsa"
<5>NOTICE: SFTP server listening on 127.0.0.1:2020
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: ssh auth "none" from "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_8.8": ssh:
no auth passed yet
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Public key login attempt for user
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: ssh auth "publickey" from "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_8.8":
OK
<6>INFO  : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: SSH login from user using SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_8.8
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Incoming channel: session
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Channel accepted
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Request: subsystem
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Subsystem: sftp
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020:  - accepted: true
<7>DEBUG : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:36706->127.0.0.1:2020: Starting SFTP server
```

@ncw Should we add support for Ed25519 while we're at it? My impression is that this is the most recommended alternative at the moment, supported in OpenSSH since version 6.5 (January 2014): `ssh-keygen -t ed25519`, default filename `id_ed25519`. Supported in golang package `crypto/ed25519` since version 1.13. Marshalled with `MarshalPKCS8PrivateKey` and PEM block `PRIVATE KEY`.

Edit: I realize now that this is about generating default keys. And *support* for Ed25519 in general seems to be in place already by supplying your own key with argument `--key`.  Pushed a working version to my repo (https://github.com/albertony/rclone/commits/fix-5671-serve-sftp), which generates all three RSA, ECDSA and Ed25519 keys. Do what you want with it. In general it seems Ed25519 should be preferred over ECDSA, considering performance, security, NSA backdoor rumors etc, but the risk of clients not supporting it (yet) is probably higher than with ECDSA. So if only generating RSA and Ed25519 we may risk clients not supporting either of them.
@ncw Your fix breaks on Windows, though. Something like this is necessary: https://github.com/albertony/rclone/commit/d4593feaa1d488c6769b100c407482c48d5d8165

Thanks @albertony - I pulled your commits to my branch and added a bit more documentation

[v1.57.0-beta.5699.e4a968300.fix-5671-serve-sftp](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5671-serve-sftp/v1.57.0-beta.5699.e4a968300.fix-5671-serve-sftp/) on branch [fix-5671-serve-sftp](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5671-serve-sftp) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I'll merge that in a bit unless you've got any violent objections?

> I'll merge that in a bit unless you've got any violent objections?

0️⃣ 

Thanks. Doc update looks good!

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.57

Thanks for your help testing @goldmund256 and thanks for the ed25519 @albertony

issue.title: Failed to create file system for "remote:": NewFs: couldn't connect SSH: ssh: handshake failed: ssh: unable to authenticate, attempted methods [none publickey], no supported methods remain

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put in to solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

None.

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Cannot use an SFTP remote even though I am able to connect with the normal `ssh` command with the same parameters just fine.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```plain
rclone v1.56.2
- os/version: darwin 11.6 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 20.6.0 (x86_64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.17.1
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

macOS 11.6, 64-bit Intel CPU

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

SFTP (in a local network).

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone lsd s1_dimi:`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

<details>
<summary> rclone -vv log</summary>

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
